label: 平織
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 53rd  . Nara National Museum . 2001
説明文: Plain weave. The most stable and fundamental weave structure, in which each warp passes successively over one and under one weft and each weft passes over one and under one warp. Tabby textiles in the Shōsō-in include those made of silk and those made of bast fibers such as hemp or ramie. In this catalogue, the term silk tabby" refers to ashiginu. See also Ashiginu. [絁]"
